info.title: Clips
info.description: Clips APIs allow developers to interface with [Zoom Clips](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/zoom-clips/) features programmatically. Zoom Clips enables users to capture, manage, and share short video recordings, making it a valuable tool for collaboration, communication, and documentation.

get.description:
Returns the list of collaborators for a clip that the current user owns or returns the list of collaborators for any clip associated with the account. 
**Required scopes** 
`clips:read:list_collaborator:admin`

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read`,`clips:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:list_collaborator`,`clips:read:list_collaborator:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: clipId
parameters.description: The clip's ID.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

data.description: A list of the clip's collaborators.

email.description: This field returns *nullable Email*. This response only returns if the type is 'EXTERNAL_USER'. If the type is not 'EXTERNAL_USER', it returns a null value.

type.description:
A Zoom user (ZOOM_USER).

EXTERNAL_USER - A non-Zoom user.

CHANNEL - A channel, not a user.

role.description:
The owner (OWNER) of the clip.

VIEWER - A viewer of the clip.

display_name.description: This field returns *nullable Display Name*. This response returns a value only when the type is either 'ZOOM_USER' or 'CHANNEL' and the user belongs to the same organization; otherwise, it returns a null value.

channel_id.description: This field returns *nullable Team chat channel ID*. This response only returns if the type is 'CHANNEL'. If the `collaborator_type` is not 'CHANNEL', it returns a null value.

user_id.description: This field returns *nullable User ID*. This response returns a value only if the type is 'ZOOM_USER' and the user belongs to the same organization. If the type is not 'ZOOM_USER' or the user does not belong to the same organization, it returns a null value.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized **Error Code:** `1002`
No authenticated

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `1003`
No permission to operate

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `2000`
Clip does not exist: {clipId}.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.summary: Remove the collaborator from a clip
delete.description:
Removes a collaborator from a clip.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write`,`clips:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:delete:collaborators`,`clips:delete:collaborators:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.description: The clip's ID.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: The collaborator user email or collaborator user ID.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The channel ID.

get.description:
Returns the list of comments for a clip.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read`,`clips:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:list_comments`,`clips:read:list_comments:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: clipId
parameters.description: The clip's ID.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

content.description:
The comment's content. Supports user mentions in the format: @\[display_name](user:email).

  Example: @\[clips clips](user:victor.lu@dev.gg) @\[victor.lu](user:devint_test_clips@dispostable.com) here it is

  - display_name is the visible name shown in the comment.
  - email is a unique identifier used to resolve the mentioned user.

  Developers can extract mention info using the regex: @\[(.*?)\]\(user:(.*?)\)

created_date.description: The comment created date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

modified_date.description: The comment modified date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

display_name.description: The comment owner's display name. If the owner is a Zoom user, it will display the user's name. If the owner is a guest, it will always display 'Guest'. If the owner is an invited email user (not a Zoom user), it will display the user's email address.

edited.description: Whether the comment has been modified.

mentions.description: The mention information in the comment, if present.

display_name.description: The display name of the mentioned user.

email.description: The email address of the mentioned user.

items.description: The mention information in the comment.

content_type.description:
The type of the comment.

TEXT_WITH_MENTION – A comment that includes a mention.

TEXT – A comment without any mention.

EMOJI – An emoji reaction without text.

created_date.description: The comment created date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

modified_date.description: The comment modified date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

edited.description: Indicates whether the comment has been modified.

mentions.description: Includes mention information in the comment, if present.

display_name.description: The display name of the mentioned user.

email.description: The email address of the mentioned user.

content_type.description:
The type of the comment.

TEXT_WITH_MENTION – A comment that includes a mention.

TEXT – A comment without any mention.

items.description: The information about the comments list.
The information about the comments list.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

get.description:
Returns a clip from the current user, or returns any clips associated with the account. 

 **Required scopes**: `clips:read:clip:admin`.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read`,`clips:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:clip`,`clips:read:clip:admin`

parameters.name: clipId
parameters.description: The clip's ID.

duration.description: The duration of the clip, where the unit of duration is in seconds.

status.description:
The clip's status.

RECORD_START - The clip recording has started but has not yet ended.

RECORD_FAILED - The clip recording failed.

RECORD_END - The clip recording has ended but the MP4 transcription is not yet complete.

RECORD_SUCCESS - The clip recording has reached its final state and is fully complete.

RECORD_DELETE - The clip has been soft deleted.

SUSPENDED - The clip has been suspended by the trust & safety team.

file_size.description: The clip's file size in bytes.

passcode.description: The passcode. Ir exists only when `enable_passcode=true`

share_scope.description:
ANYONE - Anyone with this clip link can watch it.

SAME_ORGANIZATON - Only users who are in the same organization as the clip owner can watch it.

INVITED_MEMBERS_ONLY - Only invited users can watch it.

PRIVATE - Only the clip's owner and account administrators can watch it.

share_link_settings.description: The access level, which indicates the access type of the current clips' share link.

created_date.description: The clip created date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

modified_date.description: The clip modified date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

post.description:
Transfers clip ownership to another user.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write:transfer_owner:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

source_owner_user_id.description: The source user ID who currently owns the clips. Optional for full transfers.

clip_id_list.description: The list of specific clip IDs to transfer. Required for partial transfers.

target_owner_user_id.description: The target user ID to receive ownership. Must be active.

transfer_type.description: The type of transfer event: PARTIAL_TRANSFER or FULL_TRANSFER.

task_id.description: The unique ID of this transfer request for logging/correlation.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1007`
Clips not belong current user.
**Error Code:** `10001`
Missing field.
**Error Code:** `10003`
Invalidated field value.
**Error Code:** `10004`
When transfer type is PARTIAL_TRANSFER, clip_id_list limit size is 50.
**Error Code:** `20002`
Clips not belong sourceOwner.
**Error Code:** `30001`
Source user and target user have processing transfer task.
**Error Code:** `10002`
Can not found any clip by clip_id_list

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized **Error Code:** `1002`
No authenticated

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `1003`
No permission to operate

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Transfers the task status check.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:transfer_task_status:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The unique ID of this transfer request for logging/correlation.

status.description: The current status of the transfer task.

transfer_type.description: The type of transfer operation: PARTIAL_TRANSFER or FULL_TRANSFER.

source_owner_user_id.description: The source user ID who currently owns the clips. Optional for full transfers.

target_owner_user_id.description: The target user ID to receive ownership. Must be an active user.

clip_id_list.description: The list of specific clip IDs to transfer. Required for partial transfers.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `10001`
Missing field.

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized **Error Code:** `1002`
No authenticated.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `1003`
No permission to operate

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `10002`
Can not found any async task by taskId and accountId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Uploads a file to Zoom Revenue Acclerator. 

 **Note:**  
* Base URL: `https://fileapi.zoom.us/v2/`.  
* The rate limit is 20 requests per second or 2000 requests per second per IP address or 50 requests per user within a 24-hour period
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* The caller must retain the Authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 
* Supported video formats: `.mp4`, `.webm`.
* When your object size reaches 2 GB, you should use multipart uploads instead of uploading the object in a single operation.
* For an **account-level** [OAuth app](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/create/), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) with **Edit** permission for **Zoom Clips**.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write`,`clips:write:admin`

file.description: The upload file, in binary format. You can only send a maximum of two gigabytes.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Uploads a multipart file. 

 **Note:** 
* The base URL for this API is `https://fileapi.zoom.us/v2/`. 
* The rate limit of this API is 20 requests per second or 2000 requests per second per IP address or 50 requests per user within a 24-hour period. 
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* The caller must retain the authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 
* Video can be in `.mp4`, `.webm` format.
* In general, when your object size reaches 2 GB, you should use multipart uploads instead of uploading the object in a single operation.
* For an **account-level** [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) that has the **Edit** permission for **Zoom Clips**. 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write`,`clips:write:admin`

file.description:
The upload file, in binary format. 

Each part must be at most 100 MB in size, and at least 5 MB in size, except the last part.

upload_context.description: When uploading multipart files, use the upload context to identify the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.

part_number.description: When uploading multipart files, this field indicates the part number of the part being uploaded . This field is a positive integer between 1 and 100.
The part number of the part being uploaded.

etag.description: The etag of the part being uploaded.

part_number_etag.description:
The etag part number . 

Collect and bring it back in the final request to complete the multipart upload request.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.summary: Initiate and complete the multipart file upload for a clip
post.description:
Initiates or completes a multipart upload. 

 **Note:** 
* The base URL for this API is `https://fileapi.zoom.us/v2/`. 
* The rate limit is 20 requests per second or 2000 requests per second per IP address or 50 requests per user within a 24-hour period
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* The caller must retain the authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 
* Once initiated, the multipart upload must complete within 7 days. 
* For **account-level** [OAuth apps](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) with **Edit** permission for **Zoom Clips**.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:write:admin`,`clips:write`

method.description:
The method to upload events: 
* `CreateMultipartUpload` — Create a multipart upload.

The method to upload events: 
* `CompleteMultipartUpload` — Complete a multipart upload.

upload_context.description: The upload context that identifies the multipart upload being uploaded.

part_number_etags.description: The part number of the etags being uploaded.

part_number.description: The part number of the part being uploaded.

etag.description: The etag of the part being uploaded.

params.description: The parameters for the complete multipart upload.

201.description:
**Status Code:** `201`   
 
Successfully initiate and complete a multipart upload.

upload_context.description:
The upload context. Return this field if you pass the `CreateMultipartUpload` value for the `method` field. 

**Note:**
Use this upload context to associate all of the parts in the specific multipart upload. You specify this upload context in each of your subsequent upload part requests. You also include this upload context in the final request to complete the multipart upload request.

clip_id.description:
The clip file's unique ID. 
Return this field if you pass the `CompleteMultipartUpload` value for the `method` field.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns a list of clips of the current user or a list of all clips under the account. 

 **Required scopes** 
`clips:read:list_user_clips:admin)`

**Note** 
`user_id` can intake Zoom user ID or email, which only applies when `scope = clips:read:list_user_clips:admin`. Otherwise, the `user_id` can only intake `me`.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read`,`clips:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `clips:read:list_user_clips`,`clips:read:list_user_clips:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The email address or user ID of the clip owner. Providing this parameter will return only the clip owned by the specified user. If set to `me`, it returns the matched clips of current user.

parameters.name: search_key
parameters.description: The name of a clip. Providing this parameter enables the system to return only the matching clip. Otherwise, all clips will be returned.

parameters.name: date_filter_type
parameters.description:
The clip date filter type. Enum:

CREATED_DATE - clip create date.
MODIFIED_DATE - clip modify date.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The queried start date and time in yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' UTC format for the created date range for which you would like to retrieve clips. The maximum range can be a month. If no value is provided for this field, the default will be current date. For example, if you make the API request on June 30, 2024, without providing the “from” and “to” parameters, by default the value of 'from' field will be “2024-06-30” and the value of the 'to' field will be “2024-07-01”.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The queried end date and time in yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' UTC format.

duration.description: The duration of the clip, where the unit of duration is seconds.

status.description:
The clip status.

RECORD_START - It means the clip recording has started but has not yet ended.

RECORD_FAILED - It means the clip recording failed.

RECORD_END - It means the clip recording has ended but the MP4 transcription is not yet complete.

RECORD_SUCCESS - It means the clip recording has reached its final state and is fully complete.

RECORD_DELETE - It means the clip has been soft deleted.

SUSPENDED - It means the clip has been suspended by the trust & safety team.

file_size.description: The clip file size in bytes

share_link.description: The share link of the clip.

passcode.description: The passcode. It exists only when `enable_passcode=true`

share_scope.description:
ANYONE - Anyone with this clip link can watch it.

SAME_ORGANIZATON - Only users who are in the same organization as the clip owner can watch it.

INVITED_MEMBERS_ONLY - Only invited users can watch it.

PRIVATE - Only the clip's owner and account administrators can watch it.

share_link_settings.description: The access level, which indicates the access type of the current clips' share link.

created_date.description: The clip created date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

modified_date.description: The clip modified date-time in UTC/GMT. Example: "2020-03-31T12:02:00Z"

items.description: The information about the clips list.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of records found.

**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`

**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
